translation: przywzoitka [an older person, especially a woman, who stays with and takes care of a younger woman who is not married when she is in public]
sentence: She asked me to go to the cinema with her and Andrew, I think as a sort of chaperone.

translation: nabawić się, zachorować [formal; to catch or become ill with a disease]
sentence: He contracted malaria while he was travelling.

translation: oszukać, ocyganić [to get money from someone in a way that is not honest]
sentence: He diddled me! He said that there were six in a bag, but there were only five.

translation: zapobiegać [to prevent something from happening by acting first]
sentence: Try to anticipate what your child will do and forestall problems.
They treat christmas as just another excuse for gluttony.

translation: rąbać, ciosać [to cut a large piece out of wood, coal, rock, stone, or another hard material in a rough way]
sentence: The monument was hewn out of the side of a mountain.

translation: senior, feudał [old use; a lord or king]
sentence: No man would break an oath to his liege.

translation: mowa [a group of words or style of speaking used by a particular group of people]
sentence: I couldn't understand their legal parlance.

translation: stukot (lub: trajkotanie, paplanina) [the sound of a lot of things gently and repeatedly hitting a surface; fast, continuous talk, esp. that of an entertainer or someone trying to sell things]
sentence: I find the patter of rain on the roof soothing. Philip’s clever patter kept his audience in a good mood.

translation: rozterka, dylemat, kłopot [a state of not being able to decide what to do about a situation in which you are involved]
sentence: We're in a quandary over which school to send her to.
Remedial action must be taken now.

translation: pozostawiony samemu sobie (lub: na mieliźnie) [unable to leave somewhere because of a problem such as not having any transport or money]
sentence: He left me stranded in town with no car and no money for a bus.

translation: walczyć, usiłować, starać się [to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties]
sentence: In her writing she strove for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.

translation: duszny [(of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air]
sentence: It gets very hot and stuffy in here in summer.

translation: szew [a stitch used to sew up a cut in a person's body]
sentence: The syringe was removed, the skull opening sealed with dental cement, and the skin sutured.
